urls.resource_name: OSF project (original tightness × efficiency COVID analysis)
urls.why_needed: Contains the authors’ analysis scripts and materials to reproduce growth-rate extraction and cross-national regressions.

urls.resource_name: OSF project for Lancet Planetary Health tightness–COVID study
urls.why_needed: Provides public code/materials used by the authors’ team for cross-national COVID analyses following the paper’s design.
Supplies the expanded cultural tightness–looseness scores used to extend Gelfand’s measure to 57 countries for replication.
Source for Government Effectiveness (aka government efficiency) indicator; use 2017 or updated years for the efficiency covariate.
Stable download/metadata entry to obtain the Government Effectiveness series for all countries.

urls.resource_name: Our World in Data COVID-19 (historical repo, stable URLs)
urls.why_needed: Global country-day COVID cases and deaths (per million available) to compute infection growth rates for a new replication period.
Current distribution point for OWID’s COVID dataset with CSV endpoints and variable documentation for replication.
Direct CSV for daily country metrics (cases/deaths per million) to re-estimate within-country growth slopes.

urls.resource_name: ECDC archived daily global COVID-19 cases/deaths (to 14 Dec 2020)
urls.why_needed: Original source used by the study during March 2020; enables reproduction of early-period analyses.
Provides GDP per capita used as a covariate in the cross-national regressions (match 2019 release or update for new replication).
Inequality covariate used as a control in the models.
Documentation to ensure correct series selection and interpretation for the Gini covariate.
Median age covariate at the country level as used in the original analysis; archive provides a stable snapshot.

urls.resource_name: Gelfand et al. (2011) Science paper record
urls.why_needed: Canonical source for the original 33-nation tightness–looseness index referenced by the study’s tightness measure.

missing.resource_name: Direct spreadsheet/CSV of Gelfand et al. (2011) country tightness scores (33 nations)
missing.search_query: Gelfand 2011 tightness looseness country scores data file site:osf.io OR site:sciencemag.org OR site:dataverse.org

missing.resource_name: Explicit scripts for per-country infection growth slope extraction (if not in OSF pc4ef/47pe8)
missing.search_query: Jackson Gelfand tightness government efficiency COVID code infection growth slope R script site:osf.io OR site:github.com

urls.resource_name: GEM APS datasets portal (1998–2023+, incl. 2010 and later waves)
urls.why_needed: Primary entrepreneurship microdata used in the paper and required for replication with new years/waves.

urls.resource_name: GEM Manual: Design, Data and Quality Control (2017 update)
urls.why_needed: Defines GEM APS concepts and construction of entrepreneurship measures (e.g., early-stage, wage-paying), ensuring consistent variable replication.

urls.resource_name: U.S. Census Bureau International Database (IDB) landing
urls.why_needed: Official source for country age distributions to compute s_a, median age, and demographic parameter inputs.

urls.resource_name: IDB API documentation (single-year and 5-year age groups)
urls.why_needed: Programmatic access to age-by-year population shares needed to build s_a and median-age time series for replication.

urls.resource_name: World Bank WDI: Agriculture, forestry, and fishing, value added (% of GDP) (NV.AGR.TOTL.ZS)
urls.why_needed: Macroeconomic control used in robustness checks for country-year regressions.

urls.resource_name: World Bank WDI: Cost of business start-up procedures (% of GNI per capita) (IC.REG.COST.PC.ZS) metadata
urls.why_needed: Start-up cost control used in country-level specifications; metadata page anchors the indicator and download options.
Growth control variable for country-year regressions and five-year average growth construction.

urls.resource_name: World Bank WDI: Fertility rate, total (SP.DYN.TFRT.IN)
urls.why_needed: Demographic reference covariate cited by the paper when discussing demographic structure and robustness.

urls.resource_name: Barro-Lee Educational Attainment Dataset (1950–2015) official site
urls.why_needed: Source for tertiary education/attainment control used in the paper’s specifications.
Direct download location for the educational attainment series to build the education control.

urls.resource_name: International Property Rights Index – Previous Reports (incl. 2010 PDF)
urls.why_needed: Property rights index values (2010) used as a country institutional control; 2010 is held constant across years in the paper.

urls.resource_name: Wikipedia: Military service (country pages and summaries)
urls.why_needed: Used by the paper to code length/indicator for compulsory military service and the interaction term.

urls.resource_name: GESIS Flash Eurobarometer study overview – Entrepreneurship series
urls.why_needed: Gateway to FESE ‘Entrepreneurship’ datasets (2002, 2003, 2004, 2007, 2009, 2012) used for cross-dataset validation and for newer replication samples.

urls.resource_name: Flash Eurobarometer 283 (2009): Entrepreneurship in the EU and Beyond
urls.why_needed: One of the FESE entrepreneurship waves used to validate GEM results; provides microdata and docs via GESIS.
FESE entrepreneurship microdata for 2007 used in robustness/comparison to GEM.

urls.resource_name: Flash Eurobarometer 354 (2012): Entrepreneurship in the EU and Beyond
urls.why_needed: Later FESE entrepreneurship wave to extend the replication to a new period with comparable measures.

urls.resource_name: GESIS Flash Eurobarometer data access portal (incl. FE 559, 2025 Startups/Scaleups/Entrepreneurship)
urls.why_needed: Latest FESE entrepreneurship-related survey (2025) for a contemporary replication sample aligned to the paper’s design.

urls.resource_name: Penn World Table 7.1 via R pwt package (documentation and dataset)
urls.why_needed: Source for GDP per capita (PPP, 2005 base) and related macro controls as used in the original paper; ensures reproducible access to PWT 7.1.

urls.resource_name: NBER Working Paper version (Liang, Wang, Lazear, 2014/2016)
urls.why_needed: Contains methodological details and may include appendices; cited for the main claim and useful for aligning replication design.

missing.resource_name: Author replication code (do-files/scripts) for ‘Demographics and Entrepreneurship’
missing.search_query: Liang Wang Lazear replication files code GEM median age entrepreneurship site:osf.io OR site:zenodo.org OR site:github.com OR site:journals.uchicago.edu "Demographics and Entrepreneurship"

missing.resource_name: Explicit GEM APS codebook for 2010 questionnaire (official PDF)
missing.search_query: GEM APS 2010 codebook PDF site:gemconsortium.org OR site:archive.org "Adult Population Survey" codebook 2010

missing.resource_name: Direct DOI landing for Flash Eurobarometer 160 (2004), 146 (2003), 134 (2002) Entrepreneurship datasets
missing.search_query: site:gesis.org "Flash Eurobarometer" Entrepreneurship 2004 160 DOI OR 2003 146 DOI OR 2002 134 DOI

urls.why_needed: Original authors’ compiled dataset used in the article; helpful for benchmarking and variable definitions.
Earlier appendix with data tables supporting the study; useful to cross-check construction and coverage.
Primary source for survey items used to build polarization (EQUALITY, PRIVATE, GOV, COMP) and for drawing a new replication sample.
Wave used by the paper to increase country coverage; enables reconstructing measures on the original time frame.
Main wave used in the study for polarization measures; needed to reproduce and to align variable wording/scale.
Official merge scripts to build the integrated EVS–WVS time series for constructing polarization on new waves.

urls.resource_name: Economic Freedom of the World (full dataset)
urls.why_needed: Contains ‘Government consumption as a share of total consumption’ (Area 1A) and ‘Transfers and subsidies (% GDP)’ (1B), the study’s dependent variables.
Version contemporary to the paper’s citations (Gwartney & Lawson 2008); useful to match original measurement period.

urls.resource_name: Polity5: Political Regime Characteristics and Transitions
urls.why_needed: Source for Polity IV/Polity5 democracy scores to classify ‘strong democracies’ (Polity ≥ 9) in replication.

urls.resource_name: Freedom in the World (historical ratings downloads)
urls.why_needed: Backup democracy classification for countries lacking Polity values (as done in the paper for Iceland, Luxembourg, Malta).
Endogenous control in the ‘long’ specification.
Endogenous control in the ‘long’ specification (openness).
Demographic control (PROP1564) in the ‘long’ specification.
Demographic control (PROP65) in the ‘long’ specification.
Income inequality control used in robustness checks.

urls.resource_name: Database of Political Institutions (DPI 2020, IDB Open Data)
urls.why_needed: Institutional controls and party/legislature structure variables; also provides FEDERAL/MAJ/PRES indicators.
Consolidated access to auxiliary controls cited in the paper (e.g., latitude, mountainous terrain, press freedom, corruption, property rights, turnout).
Ethnic/linguistic/religious fractionalization controls referenced in robustness checks.
Turnout variable used in interaction checks and mechanisms analyses.

urls.resource_name: OECD membership list with accession dates
urls.why_needed: For constructing the OECD membership dummy (pre-1993) used in controls.
Convenience code to fetch Polity and Freedom House series reproducibly for classification and robustness.

missing.resource_name: Original authors’ replication code (.do/.R) for Table 4–5 long-spec regressions
missing.search_query: Lindqvist Ostling replication code "Political Polarization and the Size of Government" .do .R APSR

missing.resource_name: Explicit WVS item code mapping (per wave) for EQUALITY, PRIVATE, GOV, COMP
missing.search_query: World Values Survey codebook item wording 1–10 scale private vs government ownership competition government responsibility equality per wave

missing.resource_name: EFW variable dictionary with exact construction of 1A and 1B used circa 2003–2005
missing.search_query: Economic Freedom of the World variable definitions government consumption share of total consumption transfers and subsidies share of GDP codebook 2008

urls.why_needed: Provides an archived daily Citymapper Mobility Index (CMI) time series by city covering March 2020 needed to build the mobility outcome.
Backup scrape of CMI values for many cities in 2020–2021 to cross-check completeness of the DB.NOMICS archive.
R helper to programmatically download and parse Citymapper Mobility Index data for the specified cities and dates.
Global policy dataset with dated indicators such as workplace/business closures and stay-at-home orders to operationalize social distancing measures.
US state-level policy dates and intensities to assign intervention timing for US cities when replicating the analysis.
Event-level global NPI database with national and subnational (including some city/province) entries to refine city-specific policy timing.
Independent catalog of government social distancing and closure measures to validate or supplement policy timing and intensity.
Stable direct CSV/Parquet download endpoints for OxCGRT to streamline ingest in code pipelines.

urls.resource_name: PeerJ 2024 Supplemental S1 (first distancing dates by city)
urls.why_needed: City-level table of the first major physical distancing intervention date for the same Citymapper cities to proxy the policy-onset variable.

urls.resource_name: Soucy et al. 2024 Citymapper mobility code and data (Zenodo)
urls.why_needed: Open code repository with scripts and cleaned inputs for Citymapper-city analyses that can be adapted to re-estimate models with updated policy timing.
Alternative mobility data source (2020–2022) to replicate the design on a new dataset if CMI coverage is insufficient.
City-level mobility series (ended April 14, 2022) to replicate the analysis using a different provider and extended time window.
Consolidated CSVs of multiple mobility sources to facilitate constructing a new mobility series comparable to CMI.
Open-source code to fetch and merge Google/Apple/Waze mobility data for alternative replication runs.
R tools to pull, standardize, and analyze Apple and Google mobility data as a replacement mobility outcome for replication.
Hourly/daily city traffic indicators as a non–app-based mobility proxy to test robustness of the social distancing–mobility association.

missing.resource_name: Authors’ original city-level coding of social distancing measures (moderate vs. intense, with dates) used in Malik, Couzens, Omer (2020)
missing.search_query: Malik Couzens Omer Citymapper Mobility Index social distancing dataset code OSF GitHub medRxiv 2020.03.30.20048090 supplementary

missing.resource_name: Exact list/mapping of the 41 Citymapper cities used in the preprint and their administrative definitions
missing.search_query: Citymapper Mobility Index list of 41 cities March 2020 site:citymapper.com CMI archive cities list

missing.resource_name: Original analysis scripts for the multilevel mixed-effects linear regression reported in the preprint
missing.search_query: code "multilevel mixed-effects" Citymapper Mobility Index Malik Omer Yale Institute for Global Health GitHub

missing.resource_name: Single consolidated CMI export for March 2–26, 2020 covering all 41 cities
missing.search_query: Citymapper Mobility Index March 2020 full CSV archive site:github.com OR site:archive.org citymapper CMI

urls.why_needed: Provides polling-center–level results for the 2009 presidential election to construct district fraud measures and ECC trigger categories.
Contains ECC audit sample by polling station and categories, useful to mirror/validate recount-based fraud shares.
Public geocoded conflict/violence events for Afghanistan (incl. 2009) to build election-day and pre-election violence counts per district.
Alternative source of geocoded security incidents around August 2009 to replicate the violence measure if desired.
Additional public event dataset to cross-check robustness of violence measures.
District boundary file matching the study’s scale for aggregating polling stations and violence, and for computing adjacency.
Current OCHA/HDX administrative boundaries to map districts and verify district lists; use if ESOC file is unavailable.
Provides LandScan 2008 population grid used to normalize incidents per 1,000 population at the district level.
Elevation data used to construct district-level geographic controls.
Household survey microdata for district-level socioeconomic covariates (e.g., electrification, expenditure).
Source to map provinces/districts to ISAF Regional Commands for clustering standard errors at the RC level.

urls.resource_name: US Army RC province lists (annex excerpt)
urls.why_needed: Provides explicit province membership by ISAF Regional Command to build the RC cluster variable.
Implements last-digit tests and related election-forensics procedures used to create the paper’s fraud indicators.
Provides chi-square and other digit-pattern tests for implementing the last-digit uniformity test central to the fraud measure.

missing.resource_name: Author replication package (data/code) for Weidmann & Callen (2012/2013) on Harvard Dataverse
missing.search_query: Violence and Election Fraud Evidence from Afghanistan replication data Dataverse Weidmann Callen site:dataverse.harvard.edu

missing.resource_name: Polling-station–level returns for a new Afghan election (e.g., 2010 Wolesi Jirga or 2014 presidential) for out-of-sample replication

urls.resource_name: OPM FEVS Public Data File (2006 FHCS, 2008, 2010–2024)
urls.why_needed: Download the 2006 FHCS microdata and later FEVS public-use files with item-level variables for turnover intention and satisfaction needed to estimate the models.
Provides methodology, weighting, and documentation to construct variables consistently and understand survey design across waves.

urls.resource_name: OPM FEVS Data Reports (incl. 2006 Unweighted Demographics)
urls.why_needed: Gives 2006 demographic profile and response distributions to match sample composition and verify agency-level clustering inputs.

urls.resource_name: NARA Surveys of Federal Employees, 1979–2008 (incl. FHCS 2006)
urls.why_needed: Alternate official source for FHCS 2006 microdata and documentation if the OPM portal is unavailable or access is limited.
Backup catalog entry pointing to OPM’s public-use FEVS datasets for obtaining new replication samples.
Implements the Monte Carlo simulation approach used in the paper to compute predicted probabilities from logit models.

urls.resource_name: Clarify JSS article and package files
urls.why_needed: Documentation and installable files for Clarify needed to reproduce the paper’s simulated quantities of interest.

missing.resource_name: Direct, static link to the 2006 FHCS questionnaire/codebook (if needed separately from the OPM download workflow)
missing.search_query: site:opm.gov ("Federal Human Capital Survey" OR FHCS) 2006 questionnaire OR codebook filetype:pdf

urls.why_needed: Primary source to download ESS microdata and documentation, including rounds for constructing distrust and immigration concern variables and to draw new replication samples.
Original wave used in the study; required for reproducing and for IV checks and for consistent variable definitions.
Original wave used in the study; provides core trust and immigration items for pooled models.
Original wave used in the study; includes required trust and immigration measures.
Original wave used in the study; completes 2002–2009 pooled dataset.
Convenient consolidated DOIs for ESS rounds to verify and script reproducible downloads.
Programmatic download of ESS data (all rounds) with proper authentication to automate data pulls for replication.
Source code and issue tracker for automated ESS downloads used in scripted replications.
Open scripts to harmonize multiple ESS rounds and party variables, useful for pooling R1–R4 and later rounds for replication.
Open-source multilevel modeling to estimate the three-level models specified (alternative to proprietary HLM).
Adds p-values and tests for fixed effects in lme4 models, matching reporting in multilevel analyses.
Proprietary software used by the original author; link provided if exact reproduction in HLM is desired.
Country-level governance quality measures used as Level-3 controls.
Source for GDP per capita by country-year used as macro control; provides download and documentation.
Country-year unemployment data used as macroeconomic control in models.
Defines and links to tables (e.g., spr_exp_type, spr_exp_func) to derive social protection expenditure per inhabitant used as Level-2 control.
Portal to query and download social protection expenditure per inhabitant by year and country.
Party manifesto data to recreate ‘party attention to immigration’ contextual measures discussed in the appendix.
Programmatic access to Manifesto Project data, enabling automated retrieval and processing of party-level variables.
Official election results and cabinet compositions to compute far-right vote share by country-round and winner/loser coding.
Stable release with coverage up to 2023; includes downloadable SQLite/CSV to compute contextual variables.
Independent classification to identify far-right parties and construct national vote share for the moderator variable.
Direct dataset/codebook download for far-right/populist party classifications for linkage with election results.
Policy index used in robustness checks; provides pointers to data access for replication or extension.
Documentation of sampling, weights, and clustering needed to correctly estimate multilevel models with survey design.
Confirms item wording/variable names to build the 3‑item immigration concern index used in the paper.
Original paper’s repository record indicating a web appendix with far-right vote shares; useful for sourcing author’s coding logic.

urls.resource_name: Article DOI: The Cultural Divide in Europe
urls.why_needed: Canonical reference for measurement and model details; use to verify variables and country inclusion rules.

urls.resource_name: Uttar Pradesh and Bihar Survey of Living Conditions 1997–1998 (World Bank LSMS)
urls.why_needed: Primary household and village microdata used in the paper to construct caste, irrigation, and agricultural income variables for the original analysis.
Contains author-provided replication materials (programs and prepared files) needed to reproduce the paper’s tables and variable construction.

urls.resource_name: OpenICPSR replication archive: Caste as an Impediment to Trade (AEJApp-2009-0289)
urls.why_needed: Stable DOI archive of the AEA replication package for long-term access to code and supporting files.

urls.resource_name: SEDAC India Village-Level Geospatial Socio-Economic Data Set: 1991, 2001
urls.why_needed: Provides Census 2001 village directory variables (e.g., village area and amenities) to construct village-level controls/instruments aligned with the original design.

urls.resource_name: Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) – Ground Water Level Monitoring
urls.why_needed: Source for district/state groundwater level controls used in robustness checks mirroring the paper’s groundwater endowment controls.
Portal to download time-series groundwater level data for districts relevant to the study area for sensitivity analyses.
Provides rainfall controls at fine spatial resolution to match district-level weather controls used in the original regressions.
Independent nationally representative household and village data (with village caste composition and landownership shares) to replicate the claim on a new sample/time period.
Shows the village module items capturing jati shares of population and agricultural land and village area needed to construct the ‘dominant caste’ variable consistently.
Provides an earlier wave with comparable household agriculture and caste information to check stability and for robustness or pooled analyses.
Facilitates panel or pooled replication using harmonized IHDS 2005 and 2011–12 files with consistent identifiers.

urls.resource_name: SHRUG (Socioeconomic High-resolution Rural-Urban Geographic Platform for India)
urls.why_needed: Open-access village-level census-derived amenities (1991/2001/2011 Village Directory modules) to obtain village area and water/amenity controls and to link geographies for replication.

urls.resource_name: SHRUG 2011 Population Census Village Directory (metadata and access)
urls.why_needed: Documentation and access points for 2011 Village Directory variables (e.g., drinking water sources, land area) to update village-level controls in a new-period replication.

urls.resource_name: UP–Bihar SLC 1997–98 catalog page (files and documentation)
urls.why_needed: Direct catalog for downloading the microdata and village/household questionnaires required to rebuild variables and sampling for the original setting.

missing.resource_name: Explicit crosswalk between UP–Bihar SLC villages and 2001 Census village codes
missing.search_query: Uttar Pradesh Bihar Survey of Living Conditions 1997 1998 village census code match file site:aeaweb.org OR site:worldbank.org OR site:openicpsr.org

urls.why_needed: Original dataset used in the paper with English Cloze test WLEs, German reading proficiency, cognitive ability (CFT), SES (HISEI), parental education, books-at-home, age, gender, and class IDs.
Official documentation of instruments and scales used in ELEMENT to match operationalizations (English Cloze, German reading, background variables).
Nationwide Grade 9 dataset with English proficiency (listening/reading, grammar, writing) and rich background variables for an independent replication sample.
Provides English achievement and background (incl. SES, parental education, home language) for replication on a different cohort and broader geography.
More recent national data with Grade 9 English listening/reading and background variables to re-test the association with bilingualism.
Longitudinal dataset (2016–2018) with competencies in German and English plus cognitive ability and language background, enabling replication by bilingual subgroup.
Recent dataset with German reading and English receptive vocabulary plus background for testing the claim in a newcomer subpopulation.
Central portal to request Scientific Use Files (SUFs) for all referenced IQB datasets needed for replication.
Latest cycle with Grade 9 English competencies and background variables; use to draw a contemporary replication sample when SUF entry is located.
Original analysis software used (Mplus 5.21 type=complex); needed to mirror modeling approach or verify equivalence to R outputs.
Reference for specifying complex survey/multilevel regressions and multiple imputation consistent with the original analysis.
Automation to run and extract Mplus models from R for reproducible pipelines paralleling the original Mplus workflow.
IRT software used in the study’s scaling references; provides capability to (re)estimate item models or verify WLE/PV scaling where needed.
Technical documentation to replicate one-parameter IRT scaling and WLE computation if working from item-level data in alternative datasets.

urls.resource_name: mice (R) – Multiple Imputation by Chained Equations
urls.why_needed: Implements multiple imputation as in the original workflow to handle missingness in background and outcome variables.
Enables multilevel regression with classroom clustering as an alternative to Mplus type=complex.
Provides cluster-robust standard errors for class-level clustering if using single-level regressions.
General framework for robust/clustered SEs to match type=complex adjustments when not using Mplus.
If a replication dataset requires recomputing HISEI from parental occupations, this provides official syntax/conversion keys.
Open module to assign ISEI-08 scores from ISCO-08 codes to reconstruct SES measures comparable to HISEI when needed.
